pages.text:
Breadcrumbs & Page title
Finley's Irish Pub in Largo has become an institution for locals who appreciate an authentic pub experience that doesn't require an expensive plane ticket and a passport.
Established in 2008, Finley's has become a community favorite due to its charming ambience, friendly staff and customers, and delectable fare, which includes everything from shepherd's pie, fish and chips, and corned beef and cabbage to Reuben's, burgers and much more. The pub also features a stage and dance floor, live music four nights a week, an outdoor patio with a putting green, 22 drafts, a full liquor bar, 18 Satellite TV's and more.
Finley's will paints the city green during its three-day Fin-Fest celebration - one of the largest St. Patrick's Day parties in the area. Finley's owners, Mark A. Ternes and daughter Melissa Hewett, put great care into the annual event, creating something fun for the whole family to enjoy.
"We want everyone in the area, including visitors, to know that Fin-Fest is all about having a grant St. Patrick's Day celebration," shared Ternes.
Finley's famous green and white tents will be even larger this year returning with live music, brews, food and "Fin-tastic" fun. This event features a main stage where several popular local bands will perform indoors. You can enjoy special tent parties held on Friday and Saturday for a small $5 cover charge, while admission is free Sunday.
